intro: Helictotrichon abietetorum, commonly known as the white needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Helictotrichon abietetorum is often found in association with other drought-tolerant species in its native range.
